If you're making a new show/series/whatever, and the VAST majority of your characters are white, maybe you should rethink that?

— Chris Roberson (@chris_roberson) September 25, 2013

If your claim to diversity is "Some of our white characters speak with different accents," maybe you should rethink that?

— Chris Roberson (@chris_roberson) September 25, 2013

If your cast of dozens doesn't include any Latinos or South Asians, maybe you should rethink that?

— Chris Roberson (@chris_roberson) September 25, 2013

If you're NOT concerned about the appearance of minority characters in major roles, is it because you've never NOT seen yourself on screen?

— Chris Roberson (@chris_roberson) September 25, 2013

In other words, if you're a straight white person talking about "color blind" casting, please be quiet for a while.

— Chris Roberson (@chris_roberson) September 25, 2013

My favorite TV drama of the year is @andygreenwald’s feelings about THE BRIDGE. So many shocking reversals!

— Gabriel Roth (@gabrielroth) September 25, 2013

The Goldbergs pilot almost gave me an anxiety attack. Stop shouting! Learn to love each other! [ducks under the covers and cries]

The magic of social media is its ability to bring people of different backgrounds and belief systems together to shit on each other.

tweets.author_name: Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison
tweets.html:
Did #Nashville really need to reiterate the angsty closeted homosexual trope? Aren't we beyond that?

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) September 26, 2013

I do love a Scarlett/Gunnar duet. Also, the ridiculous names "Scarlett" and "Gunnar."

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) September 26, 2013

Does the height of Gunnar's hair correlate with his sadness level? He's at sadness level 3 inches right now. #NashvilleABC

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) September 26, 2013

A Connie Britton is a terrible thing to waste. #EndComaNow #Nashville

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) September 26, 2013

Solid storyline...solid storyline...solid storyline...fucks the whole thing up with stupid C-plot in last 2 minutes. Welcome back Nashville!

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) September 26, 2013

#Nashville future subplot: Will comes out, gets a boyfriend, opts to become an actor, lands a starring role in a TV show set in Nashville.

— kentucker (@kentucker) September 26, 2013

This butt-caped monstrosity is the meanest thing the #NashvilleABC wardrobe department has ever done to Hayden Panettiere.

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) September 26, 2013

Did people who produce NFL RedZone take over running "Nashville?" Show cuts from storyline to storyline about as fast now and it's not good.

— Joe Flint (@JBFlint) September 26, 2013

Careful Nashville, you almost stayed on the same characters for more than 90 seconds.

— Joe Flint (@JBFlint) September 26, 2013
